<Link id="l00283" /><CodeLine lineNumber="283"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00284" /><CodeLine lineNumber="284"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This ThinBackend runs the individual backend jobs in-process.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00285" /><CodeLine lineNumber="285"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The default value means to use one job per hardware core (not hyper-thread).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00286" /><CodeLine lineNumber="286"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// OnWrite is callback which receives module identifier and notifies LTO user</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00287" /><CodeLine lineNumber="287"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// that index file for the module (and optionally imports file) was created.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00288" /><CodeLine lineNumber="288"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// ShouldEmitIndexFiles being true will write sharded ThinLTO index files</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00289" /><CodeLine lineNumber="289"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// to the same path as the input module, with suffix &quot;.thinlto.bc&quot;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00290" /><CodeLine lineNumber="290"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// ShouldEmitImportsFiles is true it also writes a list of imported files to a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00291" /><CodeLine lineNumber="291"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// similar path with &quot;.imports&quot; appended instead.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00292" /><CodeLine lineNumber="292"><span class="doxyHighlight">ThinBackend <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/lto/#a0ba26df9bcc2be206bc7c3d77162c665">createInProcessThinBackend</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/threadpoolstrategy">ThreadPoolStrategy</a> Parallelism,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00293" /><CodeLine lineNumber="293"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                       <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/lto/#a8dfcd0c2c963dcc17b900f0a7876f6b4">IndexWriteCallback</a> OnWrite = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">nullptr</span><span class="doxyHighlight">,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00294" /><CodeLine lineNumber="294"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                       </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> ShouldEmitIndexFiles = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">false</span><span class="doxyHighlight">,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00295" /><CodeLine lineNumber="295"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                       </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> ShouldEmitImportsFiles = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">false</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00296" /><CodeLine lineNumber="296"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00297" /><CodeLine lineNumber="297"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This ThinBackend writes individual module indexes to files, instead of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00298" /><CodeLine lineNumber="298"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// running the individual backend jobs. This backend is for distributed builds</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00299" /><CodeLine lineNumber="299"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// where separate processes will invoke the real backends.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00300" /><CodeLine lineNumber="300"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00301" /><CodeLine lineNumber="301"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// To find the path to write the index to, the backend checks if the path has a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00302" /><CodeLine lineNumber="302"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// prefix of OldPrefix; if so, it replaces that prefix with NewPrefix. It then</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00303" /><CodeLine lineNumber="303"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// appends &quot;.thinlto.bc&quot; and writes the index to that path. If</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00304" /><CodeLine lineNumber="304"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// ShouldEmitImportsFiles is true it also writes a list of imported files to a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00305" /><CodeLine lineNumber="305"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// similar path with &quot;.imports&quot; appended instead.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00306" /><CodeLine lineNumber="306"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// LinkedObjectsFile is an output stream to write the list of object files for</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00307" /><CodeLine lineNumber="307"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// the final ThinLTO linking. Can be nullptr.  If LinkedObjectsFile is not</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00308" /><CodeLine lineNumber="308"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// nullptr and NativeObjectPrefix is not empty then it replaces the prefix of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00309" /><CodeLine lineNumber="309"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// the objects with NativeObjectPrefix instead of NewPrefix. OnWrite is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00310" /><CodeLine lineNumber="310"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// callback which receives module identifier and notifies LTO user that index</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00311" /><CodeLine lineNumber="311"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// file for the module (and optionally imports file) was created.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00312" /><CodeLine lineNumber="312"><span class="doxyHighlight">ThinBackend <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/lto/#ab71d9a6e89351ab0ad64e64a4e96f4f7">createWriteIndexesThinBackend</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/threadpoolstrategy">ThreadPoolStrategy</a> Parallelism,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00313" /><CodeLine lineNumber="313"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                          std::string OldPrefix,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00314" /><CodeLine lineNumber="314"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                          std::string NewPrefix,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00315" /><CodeLine lineNumber="315"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                          std::string NativeObjectPrefix,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00316" /><CodeLine lineNumber="316"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                          </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> ShouldEmitImportsFiles,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00317" /><CodeLine lineNumber="317"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                          <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-fd-ostream">raw&#95;fd&#95;ostream</a> &#42;LinkedObjectsFile,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00318" /><CodeLine lineNumber="318"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                          <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/lto/#a8dfcd0c2c963dcc17b900f0a7876f6b4">IndexWriteCallback</a> OnWrite);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00319" /><CodeLine lineNumber="319"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00320" /><CodeLine lineNumber="320"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This class implements a resolution-based interface to LLVM&#39;s LTO</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00321" /><CodeLine lineNumber="321"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// functionality. It supports regular LTO, parallel LTO code generation and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00322" /><CodeLine lineNumber="322"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// ThinLTO. You can use it from a linker in the following way:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00323" /><CodeLine lineNumber="323"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// - Set hooks and code generation options (see lto::Config struct defined in</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00324" /><CodeLine lineNumber="324"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   Config.h), and use the lto::Config object to create an lto::LTO object.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00325" /><CodeLine lineNumber="325"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// - Create lto::InputFile objects using lto::InputFile::create(), then use</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00326" /><CodeLine lineNumber="326"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   the symbols() function to enumerate its symbols and compute a resolution</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00327" /><CodeLine lineNumber="327"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   for each symbol (see SymbolResolution below).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00328" /><CodeLine lineNumber="328"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// - After the linker has visited each input file (and each regular object</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00329" /><CodeLine lineNumber="329"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   file) and computed a resolution for each symbol, take each lto::InputFile</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00330" /><CodeLine lineNumber="330"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   and pass it and an array of symbol resolutions to the add() function.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00331" /><CodeLine lineNumber="331"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// - Call the getMaxTasks() function to get an upper bound on the number of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00332" /><CodeLine lineNumber="332"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   native object files that LTO may add to the link.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00333" /><CodeLine lineNumber="333"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// - Call the run() function. This function will use the supplied AddStream</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00334" /><CodeLine lineNumber="334"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   and Cache functions to add up to getMaxTasks() native object files to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00335" /><CodeLine lineNumber="335"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   the link.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00336" /><CodeLine lineNumber="336" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/lto/lto"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/lto/lto/#a0a018a3788daddbb88cb4308d0a0e715">LTO</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00337" /><CodeLine lineNumber="337"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">friend</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> InputFile;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00432" /><CodeLine lineNumber="432"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// particular necessary to track whether each symbol can be internalized.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00433" /><CodeLine lineNumber="433"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Because any input file may introduce a new cross-partition reference, we</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00434" /><CodeLine lineNumber="434"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// cannot make any final internalization decisions until all input files have</span></CodeLine>
